posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: You could avoid experience penalty with by keeping Rogue and Monk balanced, but it would cost you. You would either have to take all 20 levels of Paladin pre-epic, gaining an AB, but delaying your first Tumble skill dump, or be Paladin 12 / Monk 4 / Rogue 4 at level 20, losing an AB. The Paladin-20-at-level-20 version would not have proficiency in kamas until you take Monk, so no Weapon Focus or Improved Crit, or not until epic levels, so ttat's not really a valid option.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
There's really no way around the penalty, Empyre.  Every path one considers to do so is just plain ugly.

Trying to delay kama focus into epic will mangle the epic feat selection and most likely delay ED until much later plus waste 2 pre-epic slots on feats with little benefit.

On the positive side, a Pally 1-20 does quite well with any non-focused weapon waiting for the monk progression to kick in, similar to how a cleric can enhance mundane gear.  Rog10/Mnk10 gains a monk AC and 10% move speed at the cost of 2d6 sneak damage and quite a handful of much-needed skill ranks (not even a enough ranks for a detection skill without major sacrifice) vs. the Rog14/Mnk6.  The pally damage buffs will help but will be mildly dispellable (about 20% vs Grtr Dispels) and not many slots to work with per WIS 14.  No.  The optimization is 20/14/6 and you can either make advancement a painful experience or build to play 1-40.  The +6 AB boost from a successful taunt should make up for that lost AB while setting up the monk attack during pre-epic where it belongs.  The only real CON I see is waiting until Lvl 35 for IKD but that is due to the rush to ED.

If I were the user of this build, I would stock up on every Summon Creature scroll I could find/buy to maximize sneak opportunities.  Take your pet for walks while in stealth mode.  Sneak damage is the lifeblood of this particular configuration.  UMD won't help until epic rogue dumps but will make a big impact when available.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: My recommendation would be to modify your build to Paladin 20 / Monk 15 / SD 5. Take the pre-epic level of Monk early, like level 3 or so, and focus on kamas.  You'll have to reshuffle the feats and replace Toughness, Expertise, and Improved Expertise with WF Kamas, TWF and Ambidexterity. It is your call whether you want to replace Improved Critical with ITWF. Also, take Epic Prowess before Armor Skin because your AC is pretty good but your AB is only so-so. In the end, your AB will be the same, but your AC will be 2 higher, and you get immunity to poison, Monk speed, and late-but-free KD/IKD.

posts.author: Dante2377
posts.content:
well once you work with the CBC (character build calculator) a few hundred times and have studied builds, much of the limiting factor comes in clicking the drop downs.  :)

but you made it sort of easy - you wanted 20 levels of paladin and then said enough levels of monk/rogue to get epic dodge, which means either rogue 13 and some more monk/paladin or rogue 10 monk 9 with 1 level to spare.  Not knowing how easy XP was where you were playing, I split the monk and rogue evenly to avoid xp penalty.  

For the feats, I've mentally grouped pre-epic feats into several groups

required: weapon focus, weapon finess if dex build
almost required: blind fight
should work in: improved critical, KD, IKD
fit in if room: toughness, expertise

now those are just general, specific feats like pre-reqs or dual-wield feats become required for certain builds obviously.  

for melee PCs post epic, I start with wanting EWF, EP, armor skin, and 6 great X (str or dex).  That's 9 feats, so in addition to your 7 generals, you'll need at least 2 bonus feats to get that, not counting any other desired epic feats.

For this build for starting stats, you needed 14 WIS and you wanted your dex as high as possible, but still have room for other stats, so I knew from experience that 18 might be tough, so I started with 16.  Con and int 14 left 0 for strength.  That felt really solid.  If you wanted to squeeze one more AB and AC (and reflex save) out of the build, you could start with 18 dex and cut str to 8 and con and int to 12 (don't think there's any feats with int requirements), but that would cost you 40 hp, 43 skill points, 1 damage, and 1 fort save.

for the epic stats, since my build doesn't have any bonus feats in epic (except for rogue which you need to use for defensive roll) and you're adding in epic dodge, I knew you needed EWF and Epic dodge.  that left 5 slots for EP, armor skin, and great dex feats.  Without knowing about the environment, my first thought was you have +8 AB from spells, so take Armor skin over EP, thought your AB is low at 41.  

the skills were pretty straightforward - take discipline, 40 tumble, and ~35 umd for sure.  Listen and spellcraft are useful and taunt can be.  for the extra 56 points, you probably want max concentration for rebuffing divine favor mid battle (forgot that skill).  So 16 skill points left.  if you want more for rogue skills, you could get rid of taunt.  

So that was my thought process and it took about 5ish mins, with a few more minutes entering things into the spreadsheet.  Maybe 10. 

EDIT - I forgot extend spell in my list - swap that out for toughness and probably move it up the list (move improved crit or ITWF down).  Extended Divine favor is your friend!
